<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 120, 378, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 193, 200]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 222, 167, 250]]<|/det|>
CENTRE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 210, 422, 258]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 211, 902, 258]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 177, 292]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 263, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Theory (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 805, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 602, 213, 616]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 618, 728, 650]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 80. The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 72, 101, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 72, 911, 120]]<|/det|>
Some buildings are built on large, strong metal rods that are pushed deep into the ground. A machine drops a heavy hammer onto each metal rod to push it into the ground, as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[254, 132, 744, 323]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 370, 489, 386]]<|/det|>
The weight of the heavy hammer is 25000 N.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 401, 136, 417]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 401, 497, 417]]<|/det|>
Calculate the mass of the heavy hammer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[521, 479, 885, 495]]<|/det|>
<form>mass = ....................................................... kg [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 509, 136, 525]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 509, 666, 525]]<|/det|>
The machine lifts the heavy hammer through 0.72 m vertically.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 540, 855, 556]]<|/det|>
Calculate the work done by the machine in lifting the heavy hammer. Include the unit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[367, 653, 885, 669]]<|/det|>
<form>work done = ....................................................... unit ............................ [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 683, 136, 699]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 683, 760, 699]]<|/det|>
The heavy hammer falls onto the metal rod and pushes it into the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 713, 743, 729]]<|/det|>
Describe the energy transfers from the heavy hammer to the metal rod.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 743, 864, 759]]<|/det|>
Your answer should refer to energy stores as well as transfers between energy stores.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 895, 916, 911]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 323, 880, 339]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[485, 447, 885, 463]]<|/det|>
